references.paper_title: Imagenet classification with deep convolutional neural networks
references.reason: This paper introduced AlexNet, a groundbreaking deep convolutional neural network that significantly advanced the field of computer vision and is foundational to many subsequent models.

references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduced ResNet, a deep residual network architecture that addressed the vanishing gradient problem, enabling the training of significantly deeper and more accurate networks.

references.paper_title: Fully convolutional networks for semantic segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduced the fully convolutional network (FCN), a seminal work that effectively applied convolutional neural networks to the task of semantic image segmentation, establishing a new standard for the field.
This survey paper provides a comprehensive overview of tensor decomposition methods, which are fundamental to the activation map compression techniques explored in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Mcunet: Tiny deep learning on iot devices
references.reason: This paper introduced MCUNet, a lightweight and efficient convolutional neural network architecture specifically designed for resource-constrained edge devices, making it highly relevant to the on-device learning focus of the main paper.
